definition: to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment

sentences.english: Life is not all beer and skittles, still love.
sentences.chinese: 生活并非只是吃喝玩乐，还有恋爱。

sentences.english: Life is not all cakes and ale.
sentences.chinese: 人生并不就是吃喝玩乐。

sentences.english: Life is not all beer and skittles .
sentences.chinese: 人生并不完全是吃喝玩乐。

sentences.english: His  spirit was vitiated by pleasure seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他的志气因追求吃喝玩乐而消磨殆尽。

sentences.english: Can we have no higher aim in life than mere pleasure-seeking?
sentences.chinese: 我们难道没有比吃喝玩乐更高的人生目标吗？

sentences.english: Peking man speaks Chinese New Year is the beer and skittles, give priority to in order to eat.
sentences.chinese: 北京人过年讲得就是吃喝玩乐，以吃为主。

sentences.english: Thus, we become friends, and he took me played around the island, eating the seafood that tourist won't have chance to eat.
sentences.chinese: 于是朋友便交上了，之后更一起在兰屿吃喝玩乐。

sentences.english: It goes without saying that life is not all beer and skittles.
sentences.chinese: 不用说，生活并不全是吃喝玩乐。

sentences.english: Look at them beer and skittles appearance, more mischievous ah.
sentences.chinese: 瞧他们吃喝玩乐的样子，多调皮呀。

definition: to eat and drink/food and drink
clothing, food, housing and transport (idiom); people's basic needs
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
to eat and drink gluttonously/to pig out
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
